title: To speak or not to speak
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Propaganda
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Mass media - Political aspects
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Mass media - Political aspects
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Public opinion
description: A grim animated satire on politics and the media - man's general lack on knowledge on one and his dependence on the other. An allegory on the dangers of political apathy demonstrating that people who lack knowledge of their political affairs are ripe for manipulation or takeover by special interests or totalitarian governments. Animated by Willy Verschelde, background by Norbert Deseyn. Non-narrated.
